@idlemurmurs That was amazing! lol
Easter eggs in movies =/= shared cinematic universes, can we please move past this way of thinking
@ebeinke @BryanRenno Unfortunately not, but I did a write up of it on my website: https://t.co/NGctzJDqQa
@ebeinke @BryanRenno Yes! And Jeremy Vickery mentioned it last GDC too. I also did a little talk on it at a local conference last year
@BryanRenno @ebeinke Yeah, there's lots of crossover. In my experience theme park design has definitely been helpful though
@ebeinke @BryanRenno I think it's main focus is on facilitating emotions, instead of level design's tie to mechanics and gameplay
@BryanRenno I think its v. important. Something like shot composition in films can get close, but its no substitute for how we move in space
@BryanRenno Haunted attraction design too!
@FleshyTech @IMAKELSEY @amazingafroman I like seeing the Open Day adverts where I'm in the header photo they're using lol
@BryanRenno I feel like it's too obvious if I answer theme park design lol
